page.title: 01THE BRAILES AREA
page.content: Most of the area lies within the parish of Brailes situated in the southernmost part of rural Warwickshire. It is a region of intensively farmed highly productive land crossed by numerous footpaths and bridleways from which delightful views of the countryside can be seen.Overlooking the whole area stands Brailes Hill rising to seven hundred feet and topped by Highwall Spinney, a land mark for many miles around. The main centres of population are the villages of Upper and Lower Brailes which stretch for one and a half miles along the B4O35.Nearby are the hamlets of Winderton and Sutton_ under_Brailes. Banbury is ten miles to the east, four miles to the west is the small town of Shipston_on_Stour.
